intro: Cryptantha campylotricha, commonly known as the bent-stem cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often curved stems. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cryptantha campylotricha is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
